newsitem.title: UK: Eurotunnel meeting well received - analyst.
newsitem.headline: Eurotunnel meeting well received - analyst.

text.p: Channel Tunnel operator Eurotunnel SA's presentation to analysts on its debt restructuring programme on Thursday was well received, an analyst who attended the meeting said.
However, he said he did not expect the briefing to spark a big move in the share price, which closed in London at 69-1/2p, unchanged from Wednesday.
Eurotunnel launched a prospectus for its financial restructuring earlier in the day and briefed analysts during the afternoon.
"It was well received," the analyst said of the meeting.
"They provided a lot of information and details. The important thing is that the restructuring will provide the company with a lower cost of debt and longer maturities," he added.
"These are steps to restore the financial health of the operation."
The company is seeking to restructure almost nine billion pounds ($14.7 billion) of debt owed to a 225-bank syndicate.
The debt restructuring must be approved by shareholders. --Debra Sherman, London Newsroom +44 171 542 5106 ($ = 0.611 British Pounds)
